page.title: 03CHILHAM. OTHER BUILDINGS.
page.content: There are a great variety of houses and shops within Chilham village. Many of them are around the village square and the roads leading up to it.The Post Office sells sweets, crisps, drinks and toys as well as stamps. There is also an Antique Shop, a Gift Shop and a Book Shop.There is a family butcher's which is reputed to be one of the oldest in the country. The Kitchen shop sells groceries and cheeses and the Copper Kettle is a tea room. There are two pubs in the village, the White Horse and the Woolpack Inn. They both sell hot and cold food and offer accommodation as well.The old blacksmith's shop is now a garage. Other unusual buildings in the village are Well House, which has a covered well in it's garden and Thompson house with it's small door.
